body: I think instead of truncating we could impose a limit on display names that could be changed via a configuration parameter. This way, unexpectedly long display names would not go unnoticed. WDYT?
Tentatively slated for 5.7 M2 solely for the purpose of _team discussion_.

This concrete use case could only be solved by a feature specific to parameterized tests, e.g. a new annotation attribute of `@ParameterizedTest`, since you would want to see the remaining parameters when the name is being truncated. Is the checksum really necessary?

Note: I suggest to truncate parameter-by-parameter first, and truncate full
name only in case it overflows.

For example, there might be 512 characters per parameter, and 5120 overall
name limit.

That is why the case could be solved automatically, and other small
parameters would be visible.

Checksum is for keeping test names unique, so test reports are actionable, and it is easier to understand which one works and which one fails

> For example, there might be 512 characters per parameter

How would you like to configure that? As `@ParameterizedTest(maxParameterDisplayNameLength = 512)` or sth. like that?

> Checksum is for keeping test names unique, so test reports are actionable, and it is easier to understand which one works and which one fails

Each invocation already has a unique ID and a "legacy reporting name" that's unique. There shouldn't be a strict requirement for display names to be unique except to avoid confusion... ðŸ˜‰

>How would you like to configure that? As @ParameterizedTest(maxParameterDisplayNameLength = 512) or sth. like that?

`maxParameterDisplayNameLength = 512` would be OK, however, I'm not sure if it is too much exposure for a public API ðŸ˜„ 

The following would work as well:

`junit.jupiter.execution.param.max_param_in_display_name.length = 512`
`junit.jupiter.execution.param.max_display_name.length = 5120`

For instance, I'm always adding the following properties, so configuring (e.g. in case override needed) parameter truncation would be ok:

```
junit.jupiter.execution.parallel.enabled=true
junit.jupiter.execution.parallel.mode.default=concurrent
junit.jupiter.execution.timeout.default=5 m
```

>There shouldn't be a strict requirement for display names to be unique except to avoid confusion... 

I know JUnit supports tests with equivalent display names, however, let us please generate human-friendly names ðŸ˜‰

**Team decision:** Let's introduce a `junit.jupiter.params.displayname.argument.maxlength` configuration parameter to truncate the values included in display names of parameterized test invocations with `â€¦` but omit the checksum and the overall display name truncation for now.
@vlsi Do you have time to work on a PR for this?
Is there a reason to keep the truncated values ambiguous?
They're not ambiguous by default since we prepend the invocation index.

rename.from: Truncate test name with its prefix plus SHA in case the test name becomes too big
rename.to: Truncate excessively long argument values in parameterized display names

rename.from: Truncate excessively long argument values in parameterized display names
rename.to: Excessively long argument values in parameterized display names should be truncated

issue.title: Truncate arguments in display name if they exceed max length

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Resolves #2358.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [ ] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
